isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1997) - SECTION 3.5: CIRCUIT FUNCTION AND DIAGNOSTICS - SELF TEST INPUT SWITCH AND ENGINE WARNING LIGHT - ENGINE WARNING LIGHT

svcproc.title: ENGINE WARNING LIGHT
svcproc.para: When the key switch is turned to ON, the amber Engine Warning Light (EWL) turns ON and stays ON, while the ECM runs normal startup tests, and then turns OFF. If the ECM detects a problem, the EWL remains on.

Ignition power from fuse F6 (fuse A2 w/FBC) is applied to the EWL. The ground side of the EWL is connected to ECM terminal 17, which is a ground switch. The ECM applies 12 volts to terminal 17 (light OFF) or 0 volts (light ON), in response to engine conditions.
